visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly rainfall distribution using synthetic meteorological data with seasonal patterns
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with 12 monthly observations. Synthetic precipitation values (μ=127.9mm, σ=67.2mm) were generated using a bimodal distribution to simulate seasonal patterns, with peaks in June (204.5mm) and September (227.1mm) reflecting monsoon characteristics. Data ranges adhere to WMO standards for mid-latitude climates. The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio through continuous curvature interpolation, better revealing rate-of-change patterns than angular line charts. Cairo's principles are implemented through: 1) High-contrast blue series against light background 2) Legend displacement to preserve data space 3) Coordinated font sizes (axis labels 12px, title 18px) for hierarchical perception. The seasonal oscillation (Q1: 32.4-158.2mm, Q3: 169.4-227.1mm) is emphasized through smooth interpolation between data anchors.
